ygData.subject: Re: The Fishing Pole can be Tinkered!
ygData.msgSnippet: No no no! You are actually wrong! A few people do actually collect items in Everquest. I ve been in Everfrost lately trying to raise my faction so I can get a
ygData.messageBody:
No no no! You are actually wrong! A few people do actually collect items in
Everquest. I've been in Everfrost lately trying to raise my faction so I can
get a quest to get a Langseax or two, and actually have a decent 1 hand
slashing weapon, well any way, I sold a Seax, which is a nice little low
level peircing weapon to someone who couldn't even use it (because it was
rogue and warrior only) for 5pp just because the person likes collecting
things.

>I never said the fishing pole was a rare drop. The spyglass is most
>definitely
>a rare drop. Things are only worth as much as they are useful. People
>don't
>collect things in everquest. They buy things to use. I don't know how
>good
>the spyglass is, but if it isn't that good then it would not be worth that
>much.
>
>Philip Terry wrote:
>
> > From: "Philip Terry" <pjt006@...>
> >
> > Hey again,
> >
> > If the fishing pole were a very rare item in the game (1 out of 400
>drops),
> > then that would make it worth more money. But if Salvador was including
> > them in his spyglasses cheaply, then he had to making them (or being
>given
> > them by some unknown source). I believe that the fishing pole is a real
> > tinkerable item for this reason and that Salavador (if he can be
>trusted)
> > told us the cork isn't in the formula (thus, he knows it).
>
>--Eron
>aeron@...
